answers.answer: It was through csection...  either way... Carrying that thing around sounds painful.
It was through csection...  either way... Carrying that thing around sounds painful.
Omg,  I can't even imagine! I had an 8lb baby boy naturally & that was powerful... poor woman lol, bless her heart.
My brother in law was 14lbs 13oz mother in law delivered him naturally and died but was brought back, scary! Needless to say he was the last one lol.
Oh my goodness!!! She must have been huge.

That's usually caused by having gestational diabetes and not watching your sugar intake through the whole pregnancy. I have gestational diabetes and my doctor is wanting me to try and have my baby at 37 weeks and if I don't she is inducing me so he doesn't get to big

My two boys were 10lbs 6oz and 11lbs 4oz and I delivered vaginally. They were huge but great mine is a mixture of genetics and diabetes but with my second son my bs stayed perfectly controlled and he was still veryy big. Now pregnant with #3 and hoping maybe I can get it down to a 9 pounder that would be awesome lol :) that's crazy tho couldn't imagine a 15 pounder but thank goodness they gave her a c section.

That is enormous! My son was 10 lbs 3 oz and I had him vaginally and it was rough because he got stuck in the birth canal and being that I had a midwife they just had me keep pushing for 4 1/2 hours rather than give me a c-section. I cannot imagine having a 15 lb baby! I'm assuming she had a c-section but even so carrying that baby around for the last few months must have been awful! She deserves some kind of award for that haha

question: Did anyone hear about the 5'1 woman who give birth to a 15 pound in California? Omg...could anyone imagine delivering a 15 pound baby or any baby bigger than 10 pounds?
title: 15 pound baby!!!
